weeks.summary: Early days. Focus on gentle rest, hydration, and nourishing foods.
weeks.tip: Begin a simple note habit. Two lines are enough.

weeks.summary: Your journey is beginning. Light movement and routine help energy.
weeks.tip: Add a daily water goal to your notes.

weeks.summary: Tiny beginnings. You may not feel changes yet, and that is okay.
weeks.tip: Start prenatal vitamins if advised by your clinician.

weeks.summary: Hormones are shifting. Naps and snacks can help.
weeks.tip: Keep small crackers nearby if nausea appears.

weeks.summary: You might notice tender breasts or fatigue. Give yourself warmth.
weeks.tip: Plan a quiet evening routine.

weeks.summary: Common symptoms include nausea and mood changes. You are doing well.
weeks.tip: Schedule your first prenatal appointment.

weeks.summary: Baby is growing quickly. Eating little bits often can help.
weeks.tip: Try ginger tea or B6 for nausea if appropriate.

weeks.summary: You might feel bloated or tired. Support your body kindly.
weeks.tip: Short walks and fresh air can reset your day.

weeks.summary: Emotions can swing. Invite your partner into how you feel.
weeks.tip: Share your note with someone you trust.

weeks.summary: Small features are forming. Celebrate little wins.
weeks.tip: Prep questions for your next visit.

weeks.summary: Appetite may shift. Choose foods that sit well.
weeks.tip: Keep protein snacks within reach.

weeks.summary: You might feel a touch more energy soon.
weeks.tip: Plan a gentle activity you enjoy.

weeks.summary: Closing the first trimester. Be proud of your care.
weeks.tip: Review your calendar for upcoming scans.

weeks.summary: Second trimester often feels steadier.
weeks.tip: Experiment with sleep positions and cushions.

weeks.summary: Body changes become more visible. Move in comfort.
weeks.tip: Try side stretches and mindful breathing.

weeks.summary: You may feel flutters soon.
weeks.tip: Update your note with new sensations.

weeks.summary: Hydration supports energy and circulation.
weeks.tip: Carry a bottle and sip regularly.

weeks.summary: Back comfort matters. Gentle posture checks help.
weeks.tip: Consider a prenatal support band if needed.

weeks.summary: You may feel more connected to your baby.
weeks.tip: Start a simple playlist you love.

weeks.summary: Anatomy scan time for many. Emotions can be big.
weeks.tip: Plan a soothing activity afterward.

weeks.summary: Growth continues. Balance movement and rest.
weeks.tip: Try light stretching before bed.

weeks.summary: Skin may feel dry or itchy. Moisturize gently.
weeks.tip: Add a small self-care task to your list.

weeks.summary: Notice baby patterns and your own.
weeks.tip: Note what eases discomfort today.

weeks.summary: Consider your baby list needs.
weeks.tip: Draft essentials before browsing extras.

weeks.summary: Your center of gravity shifts. Move with ease.
weeks.tip: Choose supportive shoes and slow steps.

weeks.summary: Emotional waves are normal. You are not alone.
weeks.tip: Reach out if feelings feel heavy.

weeks.summary: Closing second trimester. Celebrate progress.
weeks.tip: Review your checklist and shift items as needed.

weeks.summary: Third trimester begins for many.
weeks.tip: Schedule glucose screening if advised.

weeks.summary: Practice breath and posture for comfort.
weeks.tip: Try side-lying rest with pillows.

weeks.summary: Nursery plans can begin gently.
weeks.tip: Pick colors and a small first item.

weeks.summary: Energy may dip. Choose softness.
weeks.tip: Short naps can help mood.

weeks.summary: Think about pediatrician options.
weeks.tip: Ask friends for recommendations.

weeks.summary: Consider a birth preferences note.
weeks.tip: Keep it simple and flexible.

weeks.summary: Hospital bag time.
weeks.tip: Pack basics and a comfort item.

weeks.summary: Practice calling for support when needed.
weeks.tip: Share updates with your partner.

weeks.summary: Install the car seat and review safety.
weeks.tip: Schedule a check if available.

weeks.summary: Full term is near. Rest is powerful care.
weeks.tip: Prep easy meals for postpartum.

weeks.summary: Body prepares for birth. Trust your rhythm.
weeks.tip: Keep essentials by your bed.

weeks.summary: You might feel ready and tender at once.
weeks.tip: Reduce plans and protect your energy.

weeks.summary: Any day now. You are held by your preparation.
weeks.tip: Review your support contacts.
